issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Differentiate between TaskAttempt submission and TaskAttempt started

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description: Currently in the AM, fragments may be preempted as soon as they are allocated, without knowing whether they will move into the RUNNING state or not. Leads to a lot of unnecessary kills.
fields.summary: LLAP: Avoid preempting fragments before they enter the running state

comments.body:
The patch.
Relies on the start notifications from Tez, to detemine the state of a fragment, and preempt accordingly.

cc [~prasanth_j], [~sershe] for review.

Cannot submit to jenkins since the Tez patch introduces new APIs.
+1 pending tests... cluster tests might be helpful too

Updated patch with the tez dependency changed to run ptests.

Have already tested this on a cluster.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12867903/HIVE-16655.02.patch
